scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. [Monica] says, 'Hey [Alex], I heard you helped out with the urgent task during your leave. That's really commendable, but don't you think it's setting a precedent for others to bother you on your days off?' You responded assertively, stating that maybe the team needs to be more self-reliant. Now, [Monica] frowns slightly and [Bob] raises an eyebrow. [Bob] remarks, 'Well, if everyone just starts saying no to extra work, won't that leave us in a bind during real emergencies?' You acknowledged the concern while suggesting a constructive solution. [Monica] sighs, and [Bob] shifts his weight uncomfortably.
scenes.description: [Monica] says, 'But [Alex], what if the next time it's something you care about deeply? Wouldn't you want the team to pull through for you?'

options.text: That's true, Monica. It's a tough balance to strike, and maybe we all need to discuss this as a team.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the concern, showing empathy and emotional perception while suggesting a collaborative approach to finding a solution.

options.text: I understand your point, but if we don't start setting boundaries, we'll all just burn out.
options.analysis: You agree with the concern but emphasize the importance of setting boundaries, showing good self-regulation and emotional perception.

options.text: If it's something I care about, I'll handle it. But we can't expect everyone to be available all the time.
options.analysis: You take a more assertive stance, showing strong motivation but lower empathy and social skills.
